conbody.p: The first step in creating a complex page is determining the overall layout of the module (see section ). This is perhaps the hardest of all the steps, which consist of designing nested horizontal and vertical boxes to position the child widgets correctly. A good approach is to start from the innermost elements and work outwards.

Using this technique, we need to visualize a series of horizontal boxes (see section ), shown in red in the image below, that will assist us in aligning the label correctly with its associated text field, combobox, etc.
conbody.note: If the label and text field are created by dragging and dropping an attribute from the domain model, these horizontal boxes are created automatically.
conbody.p: The following separate horizontal boxes are themselves contained within vertical boxes (shown in green).

The separate horizontal boxes for Address and Phone sections (shown in green above) need to be contained within one horizontal box (shown in red below). We also need a horizontal box (shown in red below) for the buttons. Finally, a vertical box (shown in green below) is required to group all the boxes.
